Update on this... I took a look into the code.

I managed to fix this issue=
 by adding this line at the start of the
main loop in AbstractFrontier#mana=
gementTasks():

controller.checkFinish();

Now it will check if the Crawl i=
s finished on each iteration of the
main loop of the manager thread and so =
will check max documents/max
bytes/max time.

It'd be great if this can be =
fixed in main trunk. Or if there is a
better way to fix this than my sugges=
tion, please let me know.

It also explains why on pause and then resume th=
e
max-document-download setting kicks in suddenly, because the manager
thre=
ad will call CrawlController to check atFinish() only when
notification fro=
m Frontier has reachedState of PAUSE.

cheers
